sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not associative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. Determine (A △ B) △ A and A △ (B △ A) where △ represents the symmetric difference and the operation is with respect to the Cartesian product. Show whether the two results are equal or not.
